name: Search
description:
This is an Alpha release of Google Cloud Search. This feature is not covered by any SLA or deprecation policy and may be subject to backward-incompatible changes.

The object returned from gcloud.search gives you complete access to store your documents and search your indexes.

To learn more about Search, see What is Google Cloud Search?

methods.name: Search
methods.description:
Create a Search object to Interact with the Cloud Search API. Using this object, you can access your indexes with search/index and documents with search/document.

Follow along with the examples to see how to do everything from creating documents to searching indexes.

methods.name: getIndexes
methods.description: Get search/index objects for all of the indexes in your project.

examples.caption: To control how many API requests are made and page through the results manually, set autoPaginate to false.
Get the indexes as a readable object stream.
If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: query.pageSize
params.description: • The maximum number of indexes to return per page. If not specified, 100 indexes are returned per page.

params.name: query.pageToken
params.description: • A previously-returned page token representing part of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: query.prefix
params.description: • The prefix of the index name. It is used to list all indexes with names that have this prefix.

params.name: query.view
params.description: • See this table for a list of accepted values and what each will do.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

params.name: callback.nextQuery
params.description: • If present, query with this object to check for more results.

methods.name: index
methods.description: Get a reference to a Google Cloud Search index.
